getEntryValues().Description: Returns the array of values to be saved for the preference.

setEntries(java.lang.CharSequence[]).Description: Sets the human-readable entries to be shown in the list. This will be shown in subsequent dialogs. Each entry must have a corresponding index in @B_android#support#v7#preference#ListPreference#setEntryValues_E@.

Returns: the summary with appropriate string substitution

Parameters: Parcelable: The saved state that had previously been returned by @B_android#support#v7#preference#ListPreference#onSaveInstanceState_E@.
onRestoreInstanceState(android.os.Parcel.Description: Hook allowing a Preference to re-apply a representation of its internal state that had previously been generated by @B_android#support#v7#preference#Preference#onSaveInstanceState_E@. This function will never be called with a null state.

Parameters: CharSequence: The array to be used as values to save for the preference.
setEntryValues(java.lang.CharSequence[]).Description: The array to find the value to save for a preference when an entry from entries is selected. If a user clicks on the second item in entries, the second item in this array will be saved to the preference.

Parameters: String: The value to set for the key.
setValue(java.lang.String).Description: Sets the value of the key. This should be one of the entries in @B_android#support#v7#preference#ListPreference#getEntryValues_E@.

getEntries().Description: The list of entries to be shown in the list in subsequent dialogs.

Parameters: int: The entries array as a resource.
CharSequence: The summary for the preference.

Returns: A Parcelable object containing the current dynamic state of this Preference, or null if there is nothing interesting to save. The default implementation returns null.
onSaveInstanceState().Description: Hook allowing a Preference to generate a representation of its internal state that can later be used to create a new instance with that same state. This state should only contain information that is not persistent or can be reconstructed later.

getValue().Description: Returns the value of the key. This should be one of the entries in @B_android#support#v7#preference#ListPreference#getEntryValues_E@.

Returns: The entry corresponding to the current value, or null.
getEntry().Description: Returns the entry corresponding to the current value.

Parameters: int: The index of the value to set.
setValueIndex(int).Description: Sets the value to the given index from the entry values.

Parameters: int: The entry values array as a resource.

Returns: The index of the value, or -1 if not found.
Parameters: String: The value whose index should be returned.
findIndexOfValue(java.lang.String).Description: Returns the index of the given value (in the entry values array).

Parameters: boolean: True to restore the persisted value; false to use the given defaultValue.
Object: The default value for this Preference. Only use this if restorePersistedValue is false.
onSetInitialValue(boolean, java.lang.Obj.Description: Implement this to set the initial value of the Preference. If @B_android#content#SharedPreferences_E@. If @B_android#support#v7#preference#Preference#shouldPersist_E@ is true). In case of using @B_android#support#v7#preference#PreferenceDataStore_E@, the true but the default value (if provided) is set. This may not always be called. One example is if it should not persist but there is no default value given.

ClassDesc: A @B_android#support#v7#preference#Preference_E@ that displays a list of entries as a dialog. This preference will store a string into the SharedPreferences. This string will be the value from the @B_android#support#v7#preference#ListPreference#setEntryValues_E@ array.
